title: Quoted Odette de Mourges 1953: 100. Her book is a brilliant and sensitive analysis of late Renaissance poetry, defining and distinguishing 'metaphysical', 'baroque' and 'precieux' in a most lucid and revealing way. The topos of 'the world upside down' is, of course, an old one; Curtius 1953: 94 ff. traces it back to Archilochus and quotes an engaging example from the Carmina Burana
